intro: Chytranthus mayumbensis, commonly known as the Mayumbé chytranthus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
